ARABIC: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do you not see how your Lord stretches out shadows? If He had wished He could have made them stationary. Then We appoint the sun to be the pointer to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? He could have kept it motionless if He liked. Yet We make the sun its pilot to show the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it constant, but We have made the sun its pilot;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Have you not seen that your Lord increases the shadow. Had He wanted He would have made it stationary], and has made the sun their guide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O dear Prophet, did you not see your Lord, how He spread the shade? And if He willed, He could have made it still; then We made the sun a proof upon it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have you not seen how your Lord spread the shadow. If He willed, He could have made it still -- but We have made the sun its guide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you not considered (the work of) your Lord, how He extends the shade? And if He had pleased He would certainly have made it stationary; then We have made the sun an indication of it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Hast thou not regarded thy Lord, how He has stretched out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it still. Then We appointed the sun, to be a guide to it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens the shadows? Had He pleased, He could have made them constant; then We placed the sun as an indicator for them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hast thou not observed thine lord-how He hath stretched out the shadow? And if He had willed He would have made it still. Then We have made the sun for it an indication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Have you not regarded how your Lord spreads the twilight? (Had He wished He would have made it stand still.) Then We made the sun a beacon for it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord?- How He doth prolong the shadow! If He willed, He could make it stationary! then do We make the sun its guide;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Have you not seen how your Lord spread the shadow. If He willed, He could have made it still then We have made the sun its guide [i.e. after the sunrise, it (the shadow) squeezes and vanishes at midnoon and then again appears in the afternoon with the decline of the sun, and had there been no sun light, there would have been no shadow].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do you not see how your Lord stretches the shadow? Had it been His will, He could have made it constant. Then He appointed the sun to be a guide to it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shadow? Had He willed, He could have made it still. And We made the sun a pointer to it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:45] Have you not seen, contemplated, the work of, your Lord, how He extends the [twilight] shadow?, from the point of daybreak to the point of sunrise. For had He, your Lord, willed, He would have made it still, everpresent so that it does not disappear with the rising of the sun. Then We made the sun an indicator of it, [of] the shadow; were it not for the sun the shadow would not have been known.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade) after sunrise and before sunset, from the East to 401 the West. (And if He willed He could have made it) i.e. the shade (still) with no sun, (then We have made the sun its) the shade's (pilot) wherever one finds the sun one expects to find the shade before that; it is also said that this means: a guide which comes after it;
